In cases of human coronavirus infection SARS, HCOV-NL63 and SARS-CoV-2 in adults involvement of the anterior segment of the eye, such as conjunctivitis, they have been postulated an infection route in the conjunctiva with the virus migrating in the lacrimal fluid through the duct inferior meatus until the respiratory epithelium to start its replication. 41, 42 It is noteworthy that the ocular mucosa and the respiratory epithelium share many characteristics such as the receptor alpha2âˆ’3 linked to sialic acid, it found in the tract lower respiratory and ocular tissue mainly in epithelial cells of the conjunctiva, could be related to the tropism of many viruses such as Influenza virus.
